Talk to the Newsroom:
Science Editor Laura Chang

headline.print_headline: Just What the Doctor Ordered? Not Exactly
headline.main: Just What the Doctor Ordered? Not Exactly

docs.lead_paragraph: Noncompliance to medical prescriptions is a problem that often results in recurring or persistent illness, excessive tests and avoidable hospitalizations.
docs.snippet: Noncompliance to medical prescriptions is a problem that often results in recurring or persistent illness, excessive tests and avoidable hospitalizations.

headline.main: Just What the Doctor Ordered? Not Exactly

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column discusses patients who are non-compliant with doctors orders; suggests betters communication between doctors and patients; drawing (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: A conscientious allergist I know refuses to treat patients with asthma who don't follow his recommendations for keeping flare-ups at bay with preventive medication. ''I don't want anyone dying on my watch,'' he explains. ''I'd rather devote my time to patients who do their best to prevent asthma attacks.''
